name: St. Willibald

locations.description: Bishop of Eichstätt, missionary and brother of St. Walburga

summary: Willibald was an English monk who became the first Bishop of Eichstätt in Germany. He was the brother of St. Walburga and St. Winibald, and the nephew of St. Boniface. He made a famous pilgrimage to the Holy Land and later joined Boniface's mission to Germany. He founded the monastery at Eichstätt and played an important role in the Christianization of Bavaria. His biography, written by a nun at Heidenheim, is one of the earliest English biographies.
